## ISeq interface

Lisp-like sequence abstraction for arbitrary types using `first` &amp; `next` operations only.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface ISeq<T> 
```

## Remarks

Unlike ES6 iterators this approach does not conflate both operations and `first()` can be called any number of times to obtain the current value (if any) from the sequence.

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [first()](./api.iseq.first.md) | Returns the sequence's first value or <code>undefined</code> if there're no further values. |
|  [next()](./api.iseq.next.md) | Returns a new sequence of the remaining elements or <code>undefined</code> if there're no further values. |
